pages.text: Crafting and operating machinery requires many expensive resources. Several intermediates must first be crafted in order to create these new machines.

pages.title: Magnet
pages.text: Magnets are an integral part of electric motors. Magnetite ore can be ground into $(thing)Magnetite Powder$(). The powder can be crafted into $(thing)Compressed Magnetite$() and then heated to $(bold)$(#FFFF00)Yellow***$() to form a $(thing)Raw Magnet$().

pages.title: Galvanic-Cell EM
pages.text: $(thing)Galvanic-Cell Electromagnets$() are primitive constructions consisting of a battery and an electromagnet made from a winding of copper wire.
By repetitiously passing a $(thing)Raw Magnet$() through a magnetic field, the iron magnetite becomes a permanent magnet.$(br2)This process can be simplified with a $(thing)Magnetizer$().

pages.title: Copper Wire
pages.text: Your first $(thing)Copper Wire$() will be made by working copper in an anvil. $(thing)Copper Wire$(), and subsequently $(thing)Copper Coils$(), are used in every electronic device.
$(thing)Copper Coils$() are lengths of wire wound together.
Made with $(thing)Magnets$() and $(thing)Copper Coils$(), electric $(thing)Motors$() are what drive all machines.
$(thing)Machine Frames$() are at the core of crafting for every device. They are the main use for $(thing)Invar$().
